sen.j: 犬上 御田鍬（いぬがみ の みたすき、生没年不詳）は、飛鳥時代の人物。
sen.e: INUGAMI no Mitasuki was active in the Asuka period (his age at birth and age at death are unknown).
INUGAMI no Mitasuki (his age of birth and death are unknown) was from the Asuka period.
sen.cmt: age of は2回必要ないと思います。
sen.e: INUGAMI no Mitasuki (his age of birth and death are unknown) was from the Asuka period.
He was a diplomat.
He was a diplomat.
He was a diplomat.

sen.j: 犬上氏は日本武尊（やまとたけるのみこと）の子稲依別王の後裔と記紀に記載される近江国犬上郡を拠点とする豪族で、附近に渡来人集団が多く、犬上氏自身も天日槍等の渡来人の系譜であるとの見解もあるほど中国大陸や朝鮮半島の文化に親しい一族である。
sen.e: According to "Kojiki" (the Records of Ancient Matters) and "Nihonshoki" (Chronicle of Japan), the Inugami clan was the descendants of Inayoriwake no Miko who was a son of Yamato Takeru no Mikoto; they were a powerful family that had the base in Inugami-no-kori County of Omi Province where many immigrants from China and Korea had settled; the members of the Inugami clan were often involved in the diplomacy related to such foreign countries, so some historian says that they were one of the clans originated from a immigrant such as Amenohiboko.
sen.cmt: 古事記"Kojiki" (the Records of Ancient Matters)稲依別王Inayoriwake no Miko犬上郡Inugami-no-kori County
sen.e: According to "Kojiki" (the Records of Ancient Matters) and "Nihonshoki" (Chronicle of Japan), the Inugami clan was the descendants of Inayoriwake no Miko who was a son of Yamato Takeru no Mikoto; they were a powerful family that had the base in Inugami-no-kori County of Omi Province where many immigrants from China and Korea had settled; the members of the Inugami clan were often involved in the diplomacy related to such foreign countries, so some historian says that they were one of the clans originated from a immigrant such as Amenohiboko.

According to "Kojiki" (the Records of Ancient Matters) and "Nihonshoki" (Chronicle of Japan), the Inugami clan was the descendants of Inayoriwake no Miko who was a son of Yamato Takeru no Mikoto; they were a powerful family that had the base in Inugami-no-kori County of Omi Province where many immigrants from China and Korea had settled; the members of the Inugami clan were often involved in the diplomacy related to such foreign countries, so some historian says that they were one of the clans originated from a immigrant such as Amenohiboko.

sen.j: 614年（推古天皇22年）第5回､最後の遣隋使として矢田部造らとともに隋に渡り、翌615年（推古天皇23年）に百済使を伴い帰国した。
sen.e: In 614, Mitasuki became one of the last Kenzuishi (Japanese envoys to Sui Dynasty China) as well as YATABE no Miyatsuko and went to Sui; in 615, they came home bring the envoy of Baekje (or Paekche).

In 614, Mitasuki became one of the last Kenzuishi (Japanese envoys to Sui Dynasty China) as well as YATABE no Miyatsuko and went to Sui; in 615, they came home bringing the envoy of Baekje (or Paekche).
sen.cmt: bring the envoy→bringing the envoy の方が自然です。
sen.e: In 614, Mitasuki became one of the last Kenzuishi (Japanese envoys to Sui Dynasty China) as well as YATABE no Miyatsuko and went to Sui; in 615, they came home bringing the envoy of Baekje (or Paekche).

sen.j: 618年（推古天皇26年）に隋が滅び唐が興ると、舒明天皇は630年（舒明天皇2年）、薬師恵日の進言により遣唐使を送ることとし、御田鍬が大使となった。
sen.e: In 618, Sui Dynasty came to the end and Tang Dynasty began; in 630, Japanese Emperor Jomei decided to send the first envoy to Tang (the envoys have been called Kentoshi) by the advice of KUSUSHI no Enichi, and appointed Mitasuki as a member.

In 618, Sui Dynasty came to the end and Tang Dynasty began; in 630, Japanese Emperor Jomei decided to send the first envoy to Tang (the envoys have been called Kentoshi) by the advice of KUSUSHI no Enichi, and appointed Mitasuki as a member.

In 618, Sui Dynasty came to the end and Tang Dynasty began; in 630, Japanese Emperor Jomei decided to send the first envoy to Tang (the envoys have been called Kentoshi) by the advice of KUSUSHI no Enichi, and appointed Mitasuki as a member.

sen.j: 第1回遣唐使は2年間唐に滞在し、632年（舒明天皇4年）に唐使の高表仁を伴い、学問僧旻らとともに帰国した。
sen.e: The first Kentoshi had been in Tang for two years, and in 632, they came home bring the Tang's envoy Gao Biaoren, a learning priest Min and others.
The first Kentoshi had been in Tang for two years, and in 632, they came home bringing the Tang's envoy Gao Biaoren, a learning priest Min and others.
sen.cmt: came home bring the というフレーズは不自然です。
sen.e: The first Kentoshi had been in Tang for two years, and in 632, they came home bringing the Tang's envoy Gao Biaoren, a learning priest Min and others.

sen.j: これにより、唐との国交が結ばれたことになる。
sen.e: At this occasion, the diplomatic relations with Tang Dynasty began.
At this occasion, the diplomatic relations with Tang Dynasty began.
At this occasion, the diplomatic relations with Tang Dynasty began.

sen.j: なお、遣唐使として使用された、犬上御田鍬のものとされる世界最古の旅券（パスポート）が滋賀県内に現存している。
sen.e: In Shiga Prefecture remains the passport used by INUGAMI no Mitasuki during he was a Kentoshi and it is regarded as the oldest passport in the world.
In Shiga Prefecture remains the passport used by INUGAMI no Mitasuki during he was a Kentoshi and it is regarded as the oldest passport in the world.
In Shiga Prefecture remains the passport used by INUGAMI no Mitasuki during he was a Kentoshi and it is regarded as the oldest passport in the world.
